ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
RECD. NOV 22 1900

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 177 B 1900

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, November 20, 1900.

1. The following changes of stations of officers of the
Medical Department, U. S. Army, in this Department are
made:

1st Lieutenant Albert E. Truby, Assistant Surgeon, U. S.
Army, is hereby relieved from duty at Columbia Barracks
and assigned to Rowell Barracks, relieving Acting Assistant
Surgeon H. M. James, U. S. Army, who, upon being thus
relieved, will proceed to Cabaña Barracks, and report to
the commanding officer of that post for duty.

1st Lieutenant W. M. Bispham, Assistant Surgeon, U. S.
Army, is relieved from further duty at Cabaña Barracks,
and will proceed to Columbia Barracks, reporting to the
commanding officer for duty. Lieutenant Bispham will
transfer all public property for which he is responsible to
Acting Assistant Surgeon Paul Mazzuri, U. S. Army.

1st Lieutenant E. F. Geddings, Assistant Surgeon, U. S.
Army, is relieved from further duty at Santiago de Cuba,
and will report to the commanding officer, Morro Castle,
Santiago, for duty as post surgeon.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

2. 1st Lieutenant Ira A. Shimer, Medical Department,
U. S. Army, is hereby detailed as Acting Chief Surgeon of
the District of Santiago, and will report to the commanding
officer accordingly.

3. 1st Lieutenant H. F. Jackson, 2d Artillery, having re-
ported at these Headquarters, in compliance with General
Orders No. 6, current series, Department of Western Cuba,
is hereby detailed as Assistant to the Chief Engineer of the
Department, with station at Quemados, Cuba.

4. Acting Assistant Surgeon Freeman Allen, U. S. Army,
is hereby relieved from further duty at Quemados, Cuba,
and will report to the commanding officer, Columbia
Barracks, for duty.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:
